intro: Cryptandra amara var. amara, commonly known as the bitter cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
